subject: Psychology
title: Scarcity
description: A fast breakdown of Scarcity for builders.

hook.text: 'Only 2 left in stock!' Your heart races. You buy it immediately. Scarcity created urgency out of thin air.

buildup.text: Cialdini's scarcity principle: things seem more valuable when they're rare or when availability is decreasing.

discovery.text: In cookie jar experiments, people rated identical cookies as tastier when only two were left versus ten.

twist.text: Loss aversion amplifies scarcity. We fear missing out more than we enjoy gaining. FOMO is scarcity weaponized.

climax.text: Scarcity can be real or manufactured. Limited-time offers create artificial urgency to short-circuit your thinking.

punchline.text: We want it more when we might lose the chance to have it.

quiz.question: Why does scarcity increase perceived value?
options: Loss aversion makes us fear missing rare opportunities
Scarce items are always objectively better
People prefer items that are abundant
